item.title: Abandoned large van. Someone was living there, now dumped, 23rd July
item.description:
Letter has been attached to the van from Bromley council acknowledging that someone was illegally living in the van. Now past the deadline, no action has been taken. No one has been back to the van. Needs towing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Madeline Road, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Brambles / Weeds / shrubs on river bank, 23rd July
item.description:
The brambles , weeds , shrubs which have been left uncut for over 6 months now have grown so much on the river bank edge in Brookes Park that it’s now getting dangerous because children walk along there and are picking blackcurrants and they can’t see that there’s a drop into the river which is a danger to children during the summer holidays . These river banks used to be clear of all this with lovely grass where you could sit on the river banks having picnics now it’s just like a bomb site over grown and such a mess . It all needs cutting back from the stone bridge end right up to main rd both sides of the river banks need cutting back . It use to be such a lovely walk along there now you get attacked by brambles and stinging nettles .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Main Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 243 Highway Code, 23rd July
item.description:
Since the Elizabeth Line has opened. This has been a growing problems. During rush-hour from 7:00 - 22:00. This junction is always blocked by Local Residents, Taxi (Ubers) and others. This junction has a number near Misses from members of public almost getting hit by vehicles, vehicles who are dropping off swing out in front of buses and other motorist. Motorist leave vehicles unattended. Blocking disable crossing. Blocking access to disable parking. Blocking access for emergency response vehicle / Emergency services access to private car park. Signage is in the area to restrict parking, but no double yellow lines. Buses are restricted due to motorist dropping off on this bend. Suggestion would be hatch boxed area and double yellows restricted areas along this road. When this junction is blocked people park in the bus stop further up or park on the pavement on the opposite side.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wilton Road, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet
